item.title: A man with a with a gun - A man with a sneeze
item.itunes:subtitle: A dramatized reading of a story originally published on my personal site.
item.itunes:summary: This is a reading of the story A man with a gun - A man with a sneeze. The story was originally published on my personal website, then was later reposted onto Occasionally Thinking. The recent measles outbreak has been in the news a lot the last few months. Just about every single news outlet and blog in the country has written on the topic. My degree is specifically “human biology”, so I have strong opinions about how public health and disease should be treated. Whether I am preaching to the choir, or you are still certain that you should have personal choice in the matter, read along and we will go over some of the talking points.
item.description: A dramatized reading of a story originally published on my personal site.

item.title: Mitochondria, And Your Other DNA
item.itunes:subtitle: A story of early origins, and your ancient other half.
item.itunes:summary: The mitochondrion is, in my opinion, one of the most fascinating and incredible organelles in our cells. Really, I promise that mitochondria are going to surprise you. Stick with me here and I’ll try to tell you a story about mitochondria, and about your own body, that you likely have not heard before.
item.description: A story of early origins, and your ancient other half.
